verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O love, how deep, how broad, how high, how passing thought and fantasy, that God, the Son of God, should take our mortal form for mortals’ sake!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: He sent no angel to our race, of higher or of lower place, but wore the robe of human frame, and He Himself to this world came.

verse.name: v3
v4
verse.lines: For us to wicked men betrayed, scourged, mocked, in crown of thorns arrayed, He bore the shameful cross and death for us at length gave up His breath.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: For us He rose from death again, for us He went on high to reign, for us He sent His Spirit here to guide, to strengthen, and to cheer.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: All glory to our Lord and God for love so deep, so high, so broad — the Trinity whom we adore forever and forevermore.
